sentence.Network_en: His opinions have always been distinctly heterodox.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的观点时常带有明显的异端色彩.

sentence.Network_en: Paul did not indulge some of my more heterodox economic thinking.
sentence.Network_cn: 保罗没有过分迁就我某些更显异端的经济学思路.

PerfectNetExp.abs: GRE逆序_馆档网 ... orthodox 正统的，正派的 heterodox 异端的，非正统的 outfox 以机智胜过.

词根及词缀 ... orthodox n 正统思想 heterodox n 异端思想 paradox n 勃论，相矛盾.

list.abs: Character  -... ... 旁门左道[ heretical sect;heterodox school;heresy;heterodoxy] 旁若无人[ self-assured or supercilious].
the condition or quality of being heterodox .异端成为异端的状况或品质

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (originally as a noun denoting an unorthodox opinion): via late Latin from Greek heterodoxos, from heteros 'other' + doxa 'opinion'

entry.tran: （信仰、意见、想法等）异端的，离经叛道的，异教的，非正统的
entry.def: Heterodox beliefs, opinions, or ideas are different from the accepted or official ones.

means.word_mean: 1. characterized by departure from accepted beliefs or standards

auth_sentence.content: Bain's business model was heterodox, even heretical.
auth_sentence.res_content: Bain's business model was heterodox, even heretical.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Bain's business model was heterodox, even heretical.

auth_sentence.content: Men...tabooed by society because they were believed to be heterodox on questions of social policy.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Men...tabooed by society because they were believed to be heterodox on questions of social policy.

auth_sentence.content: This article is wonderfully complementary to this existing, largely heterodox, literature in economics.
auth_sentence.res_content: This article is wonderfully complementary to this existing, largely heterodox, literature in economics.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This article is wonderfully complementary to this existing, largely heterodox, literature in economics.
